drip.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to let liquid fall in drops
drip.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Her boots were muddy and her hair was dripping.
John came in, his arm dripping blood.
The hand that held the gun was dripping with sweat.
drip.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The rain dripped down his neck.
Water was dripping through the ceiling.
drip.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: one of the drops of liquid that fall from something
drip.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I put some plastic buckets on the floor to catch the drips.
drip.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the sound or action of a liquid falling in drops
drip.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The silence was broken only by a regular drip, drip, drip.
drip.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a piece of equipment used in hospitals for putting liquids directly into your blood through a tube
drip.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: At the hospital they put me on a drip.
drip.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: someone who is boring and weak
